{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient feels numb while shaving after a parotidectomy. Numbness in the area of the earlobe and cheek is commonly associated with the involvement of the great auricular nerve (GAN). The GAN is often sacrificed during parotidectomy, leading to sensory impairment in the distribution of the nerve. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Greater auricular.", "answer_choice": "D"}
